Function Documentation

int32_t CSL_intrRouterAckIntr ( CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg,
uint32_t  outputIntrNum 
)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterAckIntr

Description
This function is used to acknowledge the specified interrupt source.

Note: This function has no functionality if the interrupt router does not contain an intd IP.

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure
outputIntrNum - Output interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numOutputIntrs-1))

Return Value
0 = success
-1 = outputIntrNum out of range
-2 = function not supported (intd is not present in this intr_router)

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EOI_REG

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    unint32_t intrNum = 15;
    CSL_intrRouterAckExceptionInt(&pCfg, intrNum);
int32_t CSL_intrRouterCfgMux ( CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg,
uint32_t  inputIntrNum,
uint32_t  outputIntrNum 
)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterCfgMux

Description
This function configures the mux so that the specified input interrupt is mapped to the specified output interrupt

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure
intrNum - Interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numInputIntrs-1))
outputIntrNum - Output interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numOutputIntrs-1))

Return Value
0 = success
-1 = intrNum or outputIntrNum out of range

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
None

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    uint32_t inputIntrNum = 8;
    uint32_t outputIntrNum = 9;

   CSL_intrRouterCfgMux(&pCfg, inputIntrNum, outputIntrNum);
uint32_t CSL_intrRouterGetRevision ( const CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterGetRevision

Description
This function returns the revision information for the Intr Router

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure

Return Value
Revision information. See design specification for details.

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
PID

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    uint32_t rev;

    rev = CSL_intrRouterGetRevision(&pCfg);
int32_t CSL_intrRouterIsIntrPending ( const CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg,
uint32_t  outputIntrNum 
)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterIsIntrPending

Description
This function returns the pending interrupt status of the specified interrupt.

Note: This function has no functionality if the interrupt router does not contain an intd IP.

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure
outputIntrNum - Output interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numOutputIntrs-1))

Return Value
1 = Interrupt is pending
0 = Interrupt is not pending
-1 = outputIntrNum out of range
-2 = function not supported (intd is not present in this intr_router)

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
EXCEPTION_PEND_SET

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    bool bIntPending;
    uint32_t intrNum = 12;

    bIntPending = CSL_intrRouterIsIntrPending(&pCfg, intrNum);
    printf("Exception interrupt is %s\n", bIntPending ? "pending" : "not pending" );
int32_t CSL_intrRouterSetIntdBypassEnable ( CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg,
uint32_t  outputIntrNum,
bool  bBypass 
)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterSetIntdBypassEnable

Description
This function enables or disables intd bypass for the particular output interrupt

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure
outputIntrNum - Output interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numOutputIntrs-1))
bBypass - If true, intd bypass is enabled, otherwise it is disabled

Return Value
0 = success
-1 = intrNum out of range

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Reads
None

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    uint32_t intrNum = 8;

   CSL_intrRouterSetIntdBypassEnable(&pCfg, intrNum, true);
int32_t CSL_intrRouterSetIntrEnable ( CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg,
uint32_t  outputIntrNum,
bool  bEnable 
)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterSetIntrEnable

Description
This function enables or disables the specified output interrupt

Note: This function has no functionality if the interrupt router does not contain an intd IP.

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure
outputIntrNum - Output interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numOutputIntrs-1))
bEnable - If true, the interrupt is enabled, otherwise it is disabled

Return Value
0 = success
-1 = outputIntrNum out of range
-2 = function not supported (intd is not present in this intr_router)

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
INTERRUPT_ENABLE_SET

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    unint32_t intrNum = 10;

    CSL_intrRouterSetIntrEnable(&pCfg, intrNum, true);
int32_t CSL_intrRouterSetIntrPendingStatus ( CSL_IntrRouterCfg *  pCfg,
uint32_t  outputIntrNum,
bool  bPend 
)

============================================================================
CSL_intrRouterSetIntrPendingStatus

Description
This function is used to set or clear the pending status of the specified interrupt.

Note: This function has no functionality if the interrupt router does not contain an intd IP.

Arguments
pCfg - A pointer (of type CSL_IntrRouterCfg*) to the Interrupt Router configuration structure
outputIntrNum - Output interrupt number (0..(pCfg->numOutputIntrs-1))
bPend - If true, the interrupt pending status is set, otherwise it is cleared

Return Value
0 = success
-1 = outputIntrNum out of range
-2 = function not supported (intd is not present in this intr_router)

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Writes
EXCEPTION_PEND_SET

Example 

    CSL_IntrRouterCfg pCfg;
    uint32_t intrNum = 13;
    CSL_intrRouterSetIntrPendingStatus(&pCfg, intrNum, true);
